segments.en: Linked Discourses 47
1. In Ambapālī’s Wood
5. A Heap of the Unskillful
At Sāvatthī.
There the Buddha said:

segments.pli: “‘akusalarāsī’ti, bhikkhave, vadamāno pañca nīvaraṇe sammā vadamāno vadeyya.
segments.en: “Rightly speaking, mendicants, you’d call these five hindrances a ‘heap of the unskillful’.

segments.pli: Kevalo hāyaṃ, bhikkhave, akusalarāsi, yadidaṃ—pañca nīvaraṇā.
segments.en: For these five hindrances are entirely a heap of the unskillful.
What five?
The hindrances of sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.

segments.pli: ‘Akusalarāsī’ti, bhikkhave, vadamāno ime pañca nīvaraṇe sammā vadamāno vadeyya.
segments.en: Rightly speaking, you’d call these five hindrances a ‘heap of the unskillful’.

segments.pli: Kevalo hāyaṃ, bhikkhave, akusalarāsi, yadidaṃ—pañca nīvaraṇā.
segments.en: For these five hindrances are entirely a heap of the unskillful.

segments.pli: ‘Kusalarāsī’ti, bhikkhave, vadamāno cattāro satipaṭṭhāne sammā vadamāno vadeyya.
segments.en: Rightly speaking, you’d call these four kinds of mindfulness meditation a ‘heap of the skillful’.

segments.pli: Kevalo hāyaṃ, bhikkhave, kusalarāsi, yadidaṃ—cattāro satipaṭṭhānā.
segments.en: For these four kinds of mindfulness meditation are entirely a heap of the skillful.
What four?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …
They meditate observing an aspect of the mind …

segments.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: They meditate observing an aspect of principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: ‘Kusalarāsī’ti, bhikkhave, vadamāno ime cattāro satipaṭṭhāne sammā vadamāno vadeyya.
segments.en: Rightly speaking, you’d call these four kinds of mindfulness meditation a ‘heap of the skillful’.

segments.pli: Kevalo hāyaṃ, bhikkhave, kusalarāsi, yadidaṃ—cattāro satipaṭṭhānā”ti.
segments.en: For these four kinds of mindfulness meditation are entirely a heap of the skillful.”

suttaplex.blurb: The four kinds of mindfulness meditation are a complete heap of what is skillful.
